snippet: Government officials and whistle-blowers have sketched out the extent of the chaos that has thrown Olympic security plans into disarray only two weeks before the Games begin.
abstract: Government officials and whistle-blowers have sketched out the extent of the chaos that has thrown Olympic security plans into disarray only two weeks before the Games begin; problems go well beyond news of a shortfall in the number of civilian guards for the Games that had been promised by a security contractor; newspaper accounts have told of recruits hired for essential security tasks at more than 100 sites falling asleep during training sessions.
lead_paragraph: Government officials and whistle-blowers have sketched out the extent of the chaos that has thrown Olympic security plans into disarray only two weeks before the Games begin.

headline.seo: Trepidation in London Over Security at the Olympics
headline.main: Amid Reports of Ineptitude, Concerns Over Security at London Olympics
headline.print_headline: Amid Reports of Ineptitude, Concerns Over Security at London Olympics
